metadata.title: CVE-2023-4133 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the cxgb4 driver in the Linuxkernel. The bug occurs when the cxgb4 device is detaching due to a possiblerearming of the flower_stats_timer from the work queue. This flaw allows alocal user to crash the system, causing a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4133` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.3.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-7.7').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.5.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.5.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.5.0-1002.2').
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.5.0-1003.3').
linux-lowlatency package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3.0-7.7.1').
linux-oracle package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.5.0-1003.3').
linux-raspi package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
